analysisEngineMetaData.name: de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.io.ditop.DiTopWriter
analysisEngineMetaData.description: This annotator (consumer) writes output files as required by DiTop. It requires JCas input annotated by MalletTopicModelInferencer using the same model.

configurationParameter.name: maxTopicWords
configurationParameter.description: The maximum number of topic words to extract. Default: 15

configurationParameter.name: modelLocation
configurationParameter.description: A Mallet file storing a serialized ParallelTopicModel.

configurationParameter.name: corpusName
configurationParameter.description: The corpus name is used to name the corresponding sub-directory and will be set in the configuration file.

configurationParameter.name: targetLocation
configurationParameter.description: Directory in which to store output files.

configurationParameter.name: appendConfig
configurationParameter.description: If set to true, the new corpus will be appended to an existing config file. If false, the existing file is overwritten. Default: true.

configurationParameter.name: collectionValues
configurationParameter.description: If set, only documents with one of the listed collection IDs are written, all others are ignored. If this is empty (null), all documents are written.

configurationParameter.name: collectionValuesExactMatch
configurationParameter.description: If true (default), only write documents with collection ids matching one of the collection values exactly. If false, write documents with collection ids containing any of the collection value string in collection while ignoring cases.

configurationParameter.name: singularTarget
configurationParameter.description: Treat target location as a single file name. This is particularly useful if only a single input file is processed and the result should be written to a pre-defined output file instead of deriving the file name from the document URI or document ID. It can also be useful if the user wishes to force multiple input files to be written to a single target file. The latter case does not work for all formats (e.g. binary, XMI, etc.), but can be useful, e.g. for Conll-based formats. This option has no effect if the target location points to an archive location (ZIP/JAR). The #PARAM_COMPRESSION is respected, but does not automatically add an extension. The #PARAM_STRIP_EXTENSION has no effect as the original extension is not preserved.

configurationParameter.name: useDocumentId
configurationParameter.description: Use the document ID as file name even if a relative path information is present.

configurationParameter.name: escapeDocumentId
configurationParameter.description: URL-encode the document ID in the file name to avoid illegal characters (e.g. \, :, etc.)

configurationParameter.name: overwrite
configurationParameter.description: Allow overwriting target files (ignored when writing to ZIP archives).
